properties.Name: FacilityOfPaymentProvision
properties.Description:
There are a relatively few number of situations in which the Insurer pays proceeds to someone that is not the designated beneficiary.

A Facility-Of-Payment Provision permits an insurer to pay all or a portion of the proceeds to someone who, though not named in the policy, has a valid right.

Examples:

- named beneficiary is a minor
- named beneficiary is deceased
- no claim submitted within specific period of time
- costs were incurred by another party such as medical or funeral expenses

Columns.Name: FacilityOfPaymentProvisionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Facility of Payment Provision.

Columns.Name: FacilityOfPaymentProvisionName
Columns.Description: The name of a Facility of Payment Provision.

Columns.Name: FacilityOfPaymentProvisionDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Facility of Payment Provision.
